alert.note: Alert for Johnston (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 6:54AM EDT until July 11 at 2:22AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Raleigh NC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in North Carolina... Neuse River Near Clayton affecting Johnston County. .Runoff from heavy rain over the past 24 hours has resulted in a rapid rise on the Neuse River near Clayton early this morning. The rate of rises are beginning to slow but the river will likely crest right at the flood stage of 9 feet by around midday. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO AROUND MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neuse River Near Clayton. * WHEN...From this morning to just around midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. Minor overflow occurs on both banks. Water reaches the edge of the Neuse River Greenway trail. At 10.0 feet, Upstream of the gage site, the Neuse River Greenway at Covered Bridge Road begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 8.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 9.1 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 am EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Thu Neuse River Clayton 9.0 8.5 Sun 6 am EDT 3.9 2.1 1.9 1.8 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Do not let children play near flooded waterways. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued this evening by 700 PM EDT.
